title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 345.1 - Application to practice chiropractic
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 345.1 - Application to practice chiropractic

State Regulations

Application by a duly licensed chiropractor of the State of

New York to practice under the Workers' Compensation Law shall be made upon a
form furnished by the chairman, Workers' Compensation Board, which shall be
filed with the Chiropractic Practice Committee, Workers' Compensation Board, 180 Livingston Street, Brooklyn, NY 11248. Such application shall state, fully
and truthfully, all the information required by law and the applicant shall
make and sign the statutory agreement. The chairman will notify the
chiropractor of approval of his or her application within 60 days after receipt
by the chairman of a recommendation for approval from the Chiropractic Practice

Committee. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
345.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
